result.execSummary:
The defendant Otis D Pirtle was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Cocaine (<=1g), a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(cm)1g.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
If revoked:
Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program.
Apply 27 days sentence credit.
Same Conditions for Extended Supervision apply as to Conditions for Probation, if revoked.

Court will allow for transfer to Milwaukee County.
Court will also allow for transfer through the inter-state compact to any other State (if they are willing to take defendant) for purposes of College.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs, DNA surcharge and Buy Money are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.  Buy Money to be paid to the City of Waukesha Police Department.

  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended by Agent.
Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.

Criminal Thinking Class.
No contact with the co-actor (D. S.).
ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

timeConds.notes:
FIRST 75 DAYS:  Non-working hours (Huber) with all standard release conditions.  Defendant to report to Huber by 06:00 p.m. on 04-17-2017.
BALANCE STAYED - to be used at agent's discretion.
Court will allow to be served in Milwaukee County and under any conditions to facilitate transfer.

Jayne Davis Dewire appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Otis D Pirtle in court with attorney Joseph James Dorlack.

State presented their sentencing recommendations.
Defense presented their sentencing recommendations.

Court orders the following:
Total Prison:  5 Years.
Initial Confinement:  2 Years.
Extended Supervision:  3 Years.
27  Days Credit - IF REVOKED.
STAYED.

IF REVOKED:
Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

Term of Probation:  2.5 Years.
Court will allow for transfer to Milwaukee County.
Court will also allow for transfer through the inter-state compact to any other State (if they are willing to take him) for purposes of College.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
Criminal Thinking Class
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended by the agent;
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
DNA sample to be provided.
No Contact with:  Co-Actor (D.Scott).

Buy Money:  $400 (to be paid to City of Waukesha Police Dept. - To be paid before any costs/fines).
Costs:  $268
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  $250
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.

CONDITION TIME: 
6 Months in the Waukesha County Jail w/huber (all standard release conditions).
First 75 Days to be served.
Defendant to report to Huber by 6 pm.  on:  04/17/17.
Court will allow to be served in Milwaukee County and under any conditions to facilitate transfer.
Balance STAYED - To be used at agent's discretion.  

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.

Defense requests expunction and presented arguments.
State takes no postition.
Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.
Wisconsin Community Service non-compliance letter dated 04/07/17 received and filed.
Sentencing hearing on April 10, 2017 at 02:00 pm.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Lesli S Boese appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Otis D Pirtle in court, in custody, with attorney Joseph James Dorlack.  

Matter originally scheduled for a jury trial - However, parties have reached an agreement and are requesting to go to Plea today.

State moves to amend both counts 1 & 2 from Class F Felonies to Class G Felonies.
Defense has no objections.
Second Amended Information filed.

Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to count 1.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of count 1.
Counts 2 & 3 are dismissed as read ins.

Matter set over for sentencing.

Defense is requesting the bail be reinstated.
State objects and presented arguments to the court.

Court reinstates bail as previously fixed.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 10, 2017 at 02:00 pm.
Second Amended Information.
Amended Information.

Lesli Boese appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant Otis D Pirtle in court, in custody, with attorney Joseph James Dorlack.   

Matter will proceed to trial tomorrow.

Defense argues reinstatement of bail.
State objects and presented arguments.
Defense presented a response.
Court denies - Defense request for reinstatement of bail.
Bail remains revoked and defendant to remain in custody pending resolution of this matter.

Defense believes he is missing one DVD/CD of one transaction with the CI.
State has no such DVD/CD - Request forwarded to the City of Waukesha for response.

Court will allow for the defendant to appear for trial in street clothes.
Defense may be requesting a court/bench trial as opposed to a jury trial (not sure at this point).
State would have no objection to that.
That will be address tomorrow morning.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Otis D Pirtle in court with attorney Joseph Smith.  Lesli S Boese appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Detective Koeppel fromthe City of Waukesha was sworn and testified on behalf of the State. Cross examination by the defense. State rests. No testimony by the defense. State moves for bind over. Defense objects.   Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
Preliminary hearing on July 2, 2015 at 10:00 am.
